bug.author: jmsking
bug.summary: Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: Timeout: request did not complete within requested timeout 30s
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
when i start kubeflow according to the document as https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/ $kfctl apply all -V Then there occurs a errors as follows INFO[0001] creating attributemanifest/istioproxy filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:447" Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: Timeout: request did not complete within requested timeout 30s
Any suggestion is much appreciate

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.92. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I have a similar issue `Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1"`

I believe this is related to k8s changes in v1.16 <denchmark-link:https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/>https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/</denchmark-link>
A quick workaround if you are using <denchmark-link:http://multipass.run/>multipass</denchmark-link> with <denchmark-link:http://microk8s.io/>microk8s</denchmark-link> is to install v1.14. I just tried it and it worked fine. Follow the steps in <denchmark-link:https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow>https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow</denchmark-link> but install microk8s via instead.
Can you share the output of --all-namespaces?
Kubeflow doesn't work on 1.16 yet. See: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/issues/375>kubeflow/manifests#375</denchmark-link>
